Posts.Title: A moan if I may !

Posts.Content: Hi sorry you're having such a bad time it's really hard isn't it. I was diagnosed in November with aggressive grade 3 in two nodes.   I've just completed my treatment but emotionally I'm struggling on wishing I had my old life back. I won't say too much about your treatment but I do understand with the issues with your children. My youngest are 18 and 14 and I'm devastated at the thought of recurrence or leaving them. My 18 year old had extreme school anxiety and has been at home with me since 11   We are so close and he still needs me so much. Unfortunately the anxiety has passed to my younger daughter although she copes much better than him. Her anxiety was very high at my diagnosis and the school although initially supportive soon began to change when her school refusal continued.  It was a horrible time for us I was always the strong one making phone calls and attending school meetings and suddenly I couldn't do it. My husband had to step in but trying to get her to school in the mornings and dealing with his job school and my chemo was too much for us. The school were talking about fines and in fact sent us a letter to fine us both. It's awful how we got treated at this dreadful time in our lives. To avoid fine and court we removed her from school to home educate her. I know this isn't ideal and not much home educating has took place but it was the best thing at the time for us as a family. Maybe you could consider this. My daughter is starting back in September she says she wants to as will be year 10 and wants her Gcses but I am dreading it. I feel emotionally battered and scared her school refusal will start again. Just saying I understand and you can only do so much we aren't super human and sadly cancer doesn't care about our other difficulties or our children's needs. Just take it day by day and love your family as I know you do is  all we can aim for. You'll get through it message me if you need to x

Posts.Title: WHOSE READY FOR A MEET UP??

Posts.Content: Believe me as some people on here know I feel your pain. Diagnosed in November Grade 3 with nodes and terrified. I still grieve my old life now but some how I'm getting there. I had three scans and no spread. Like you I found the lump through pain in my breast and then in the shower felt something under my arm which must have been the nodes. I was told several looked involved and even googled the word several to try and work out what the oncologist meant. It turned out only two were involved so even though I thought I could feel lots under my arm no one can really tell till surgery. Take care of yourself and take time to adjust. The support on here is amazing and while I'm here thank you to everyone who helps me here. If I can help in any way message me xx

Posts.Title: Anyone refused radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi James sorry you're in this situation but try to take it a step at a time .I had my biopsy result showing grade three in lymph nodes which meant there may have been more spread to organs or bones. Before a treatment plan could be decided a full picture has to be gained therefore I had three different scans thankfully all showed no spread. Once these results were in my plan was decided which for me was mastectomy then chemo. This is normal procedure for larger cancer or node involvement so the best treatment can begin .Hope all is well for you both I'm a year and a half on now and doing well .

Posts.Title: Depressed

Posts.Content: Hi shellian just sending a supportive hug I'm so sorry you still feel this way I'm slowly digging my way out. Financial pressure won't help and remember it's not that long since you had big surgery so don't put huge expectations on yourself. Could the Citizens Advice help with any benefits etc you may be entitled to  .Have you been back to your doctor for you low mood.  I sometimes ring Breast Cancer Care the ladies on the phone are great at listening doesn't matter how often or long your call. This illness puts immense pressure on relationships. I'm lucky with my hubby but we've been pushed by this ii know I'm not quite the same carefree person I was and life is slightly different for my family now.  I find it hard to talk about the future with him as we did before.  Please look after yourself contact your Bcn or a friend and slowly open those curtains when you're ready xxx I know you're a strong lady we all have done weeks xxx

I keep sitting in bedroom crying and reading forums my husband even said he'd remove my kindle if I don't stop. I just want my old life back I was so very happy. Don't know what to do .

Posts.Title: I just cant take anymore

Posts.Content: So pleased people had such good news yesterday. I however came home in tears again . My blood pressure has always been high but they were concerned about it with chemo plus the new oncologist casually mentioned an enlarged node under my other arm and I was devastated. She said it would be nothing but worried me so much my lovely breast care nurse arranged a scan this morning. Thankfully it is just an enlarged node I have  been to doctors first thing and now have blood pressure tablets. The strain of all this is really getting to me. The oncologist also told us chemo is not a cure and the cancer can return at any number of years plus scared us with awful chemo risks feel really deflated. Does anyone know how long the usual wait is between mastectomy and chemo getting worried about this now. Thanks
Posts.Title: Any advice

Feel stupid I didn't find lump earlier feel I've let everyone down.  I think there was a lot of lymph node involvement really worried about results from mastectomy. I know I'm pushing everyone away but just want to cry on my own and not spoil their happiness. I'm only 48 with no family history and still can't believe this.

Posts.Title: Feeling deflated

Posts.Content: Hi everyone sorry for going on again but does anyone after treatment feel like me. I think I've gone through all the stages of grief denial anger complete fear but now just over a year later I have a new problem I'm actually happy. Anyone who knows me on here knows I've been traumatised by this and an emotional wreck. I've spent a year googling every aspect of my diagnosis and reading other forums in desperation at times my poor family have seem me go from a happy person to a complete wreck but now I feel I've exhausted all my emotions and have started to accept it all and feel happy. The problem is I'm scared of this new feeling. I think being Aggressive Grade three in nodes I'm quite high risk of recurrence so am I silly to be happy. I was so happy before life was so good and then suddenly from Nowhere !! This massive lump appeared. It was all doom and gloom at first from oncologist and before I knew it rushed through three different body scans  thankfully no spread and mastectomy. Then chemo radiotherapy and ovary removal. I really have been traumatised so now I'm scared of this happiness. Do I just enjoy it or am I heading for a fall. Anyone else feel this. Thanks for listening x
Posts.Title: Anyone Feel Like This

Posts.Content: Hi Dayityrose just sending you some love. I'm so sorry B.C. has affected you so badly. I've been very lucky physically but emotionally been a different story .For my family I'm fighting the demons to get the old me back but doubt things will be quite the same .I have four lovely children which I thought was good but seem to remember you beat me there !  So hope you have lots of support .I know you're a strong lady xxx
Posts.Title: Does anyone know anything about PIP?

Posts.Content: Sorry if I'm no help but you've post really touched me. I have grade 3 2 nodes and 36 mm it's so hard I'm still in despair even though diagnosed November. I've four children aged 26 to 14 and even though they're older I still don't want to leave them aged 48. I've recently been talking to a lovely lady on here with a similar diagnosis and age and it helps a lot. I'm sure you're treatment plan will help you and keep asking for help when needed. At the moment I feel my life will never be the same I'm blessed with a wonderful hubby breakfast in bed every morning but I'm still gripped by sadness for my carefree life .I'm half way through chemo and just want to get to radiotherapy which I hope will be easier. Sorry if I haven't helped but just to reassure you're not alone and you're feelings are normal. Take care and focus on your positive treatment plan x
Posts.Title: Feeling deflated

Posts.Content: Hi all and stormy daze I post  quite often and probably bore everyone with my emotional struggles but felt I had to comment if only in solidarity. I was diagnosed November 2016 but I have struggled from the beginning. I'm probably doing better than ever now but it's so hard. My big i issue is recurrence fears as I think I'm quite high risk   my children are so close to me the youngest is 15 so  not babies but my 18 and 15 year old are both at home with me due to various anxiety issues. My son is 18 is inseparable from me and the thought of leaving them just breaks me.  I was 48 at diagnosis and find the insecure future's hard to cope with.  I know I have to but just want to grow old with my lovely hubby and see my children to adulthood. I didn't have or want reconstruction but it's sad sometimes putting my prosthesis on.  I do read the blogs and find they help seeing younger people dealing with this really humbled me and I tell myself to just smile and keep keeping on.  Love to all of us here xx

Posts.Title: Predict

Posts.Content: Hi kacang  that's interesting about the tendons   I've been on Anastrozole about Nine months now. I had some discomfort in my arm after doing star jump exercise don't ask !  I thought it was lymphedema starting but rang Bcn and she didn't think so and neither do I now. It hurt if I rotated my arm. The muscle at the top hurt and when I bent my elbow it hurt down my arm. I also had my fingers locking previously and suddenly realised it's probably due to Anastrozole. I googled it and think it's the arm tendons it's eased a lot now but arm still hurts when I stretch it. Not visited doctor do you think i need to.

Posts.Content: Hi chloecat45 i had a bolus  too mine was taped down I was always asked if I was allergic to tape first. I also had a mastectomy so was also flat i remember it being very cold but not too heavy. I was also told it was to boost the intensity of the rays and bring it nearer to skin and as my lump was just under skin it made sense  i was fine with it But did get a bit of very sore skin after i had read a bolus can add to sore skin but was never told this  hope this helps and you're a bit better soon xxx

Posts.Title: Strange pain after slb

Posts.Content: Just had clear Mri scan results over the phone after scan last week. Had clear scans in November when diagnosed but due to back pain persuaded my oncologist to do a scan although she was adamant it would be clear which it is. My tumour was Grade 3 two nodes and as many will know from my posts I've really struggled and still am. I'm on antidepressants something I thought I'd never do and at the moment finding every day hard. The problem is I want my Very Happy carefree life back and know I never can. I try hard but this awful feeling of something being wrong never goes   of course I'm pleased with the scan but sad that this will be my future now dealing with results and fear. Posts.Title: Anyone had mammogram recall due to technical glitch

Posts.Content: Hi Sosad2019 sorry for this hard time you're having .I was diagnosed November 2016   .My tumour was 36 mm  and aggressive Grade three in two nodes. It was an awful time for me I had three types of body scans and was pushed into sheer terror .I was only 48 always so healthy no family history so like your mum i was completely floored  i have four children youngest were 13 and 17 and both suffer anxiety and don't attend school or college after many years of trying ! So I just couldn't cope with fear of leaving them. My scans all came back clear . I'm two years on now and thankfully doing well . I still do get down days it's been emotionally hard for me but these days are getting easier. Just a few ideas  i had an NHS psychologist but I didn't gel with her and only had a few sessions  i had to do a lot of digging myself which was hard when I felt so low but I found Breast Cancer Care Someone Like Me service which is excellent They have a website with contact number  They match you with a lady similar age and stage and diagnosis to you  i had a lovely lady who rang me every few weeks for nearly twelve months in the comfort of your home. I also contacted The Haven Breast Cancer Centre .They offer all kinds of support and free counselling .As I didn't live near a centre i had telephone counselling for a number of weeks .If your mum live s near one or a Maggie's Centre i believe they are excellent but if she can't than the telephone option is ideal. Much love to you and your mum xx

Your husband loves you he will understand. Been with my hubby thirty years now I'm 49 met at 18 were so close  butI've really tested him through this. I'd give anything to change it and wish it away for him and my children. They've seen me at my lowest but they love me and support me as I would my hubby if tables were turned. Don't beat yourself up be proud of yourself we all have our limits .I'm sure your mum thinks the world of you even if she doesn't say it and your care for her is lovely.  My counsellor told me when I said I wasn't coping I was just overwhelmed with emotion I didn't know what to do  with.
